first_translate: good grief...

hangle: 용병 다루는 법 같은 걸 왜 물어보는 거야?
first_translate: why are you asking me about how to deal with mercenaries?
huh?
it’s because his grace told me to do something for him.

hangle: 난 용병 쪽은 잘 모르니까 물어본 거야.
first_translate: I don’t know much about mercenaries, so I asked.
no... wait.
then what did duke abel tell you--
ugh! why is this carriage stopping all of a sudden?

hangle: 이 마차는 왜 갑자기 서는 거야.
first_translate: ugh! why is this carriage stopping all of a sudden?
siegren, look at that!
we’re here.
this must be the fourth wall.

hangle: 바로 아벨이 시킨 일을 하러 가야겠어!
first_translate: now we have to go take care of what abel ordered us to do!
hm? what is it, siegren?
the step on this carriage is pretty high up.
if you get down like that, you’ll fall over.
let me help you out.
haha.
what’s so funny?
my bad.
fiona green...

hangle: 나 같은 낯선 소년에게도 잘해주는 이상한 여자애다.
first_translate: ...is such a strange girl who treats even someone she barely knows well.

hangle: 아직도 그 상냥함과 다정함은 못 믿겠지만
first_translate: even though her kindness still feels unbelievable,

hangle: 피오나에게 보답하고 싶다는 마음 정도는 있다.
first_translate: at least I want to repay her somehow.
thanks for helping me down,
siegren.

hangle: 아주 조금씩, 이런 사소한 행동이라도 하면
first_translate: maybe if I keep doing these small things little by little,
I might be able to pay back my debt one day.
that thought suddenly crossed my mind.
I want to become kinder.
I want to become kinder.
is this real?
of course.
doesn’t it bear the crest of house abel?
but aren’t you just kids?
this doesn’t make any sense.
go home instead of spouting nonsense, kid!

hangle: 4 성벽에는 날 아는 사람이 없으니까 이럴 만도 하지.
first_translate: well, no one from the fourth wall recognizes me anyway, so they’d react like this.
excuse me.
you can choose not to believe me or whatever,
but will you be held responsible when you realize your mistake later?
uh... after reading through this document,
it seems as though this really was written by duke abel himself.
all of a sudden he’s using formal language again.
I’m lady fiona green.

hangle: 4 성벽의 불미스러운 일을 처리하라는 명을 받고 왔습니다.
first_translate: I’ve come under orders to resolve the unpleasant matter happening within the fourth wall.
l-lady fiona?

hangle: 혹시 이게 어떤 불미스러운 일인지는 아는 건지…?
first_translate: do you happen to know anything about this incident?

hangle: 당연하죠. 그 서류에 있는 내용은 모두 숙지했어요.
first_translate: of course. I read everything mentioned in those documents.

hangle: 정 못 믿겠다면 거기 있는 내용을 전부 읊을 수도-
first_translate: and if you still refuse to trust me, then I could recite every single line--
n-no!
not at all!
tell me how I may assist you.
firstly, please allow our soldiers to arrest the criminals.

hangle: 두 번째로 마을 광장에 사람들을 모아 주세요.
first_translate: secondly, gather everyone in the town square.
and thirdly...

hangle: 시그렌, 용병들이 주로 어디에서 모이는지 알아?
first_translate: siegren, where do most of the mercenaries usually hang around?
I know.

hangle: 성벽 근처에 있는 주점에 항상 모여 있어.
first_translate: they always meet at the bar near the walls.
did you hear that? the bar--
with this, preparations are complete...
he thinks I’m just some brat, but hopefully he does his job properly.
just what exactly did duke abel order you to do?
um, judging by their future prospects and specific plans,

hangle: 나도 봐줄 생각 없는 데다 아벨의 제스처로 판단하면
first_translate: as well as considering the fact that abel isn’t going to show them mercy,

hangle: 뭔가 신체 일부가 잘리는 형벌이 될 가능성이 큰데….
first_translate: there’s a good chance that they’ll receive corporal punishment involving amputation...
aah... um...
siegren is only fourteen years old right now.
I shouldn’t say anything yet...
it’s nothing big.
duke abel simply wanted me to give fair judgment.

hangle: 어차피 안 따라올 거니까 적당히 둘러대자.
first_translate: anyway, since you won’t follow me there, let’s leave it at that.
so you’re definitely not coming along, right?
I wanna come too.
huh?!
I said I’m gonna come with you.

hangle: 내가 따라가면 안 되는 일인 거야?
first_translate: or am I not allowed to tag along?
w-well, it’s not that...

hangle: 애들이 보기엔 쪼오끔 잔인할 수도 있어.
first_translate: it’s just that children probably shouldn’t see stuff like this.

hangle: 너 내가 전쟁터에서 구르다 온 놈이란 거 잊고 있지?
first_translate: are you forgetting that I used to fight on battlefields?

hangle: …네가 보았던 흉터도 다 예전 거고, 최근에 당한 건 아냐.
first_translate: your scars were also from before, not recently inflicted ones either.

hangle: 첫 만남이 그래서 못 미더울지도 모르겠지만….
first_translate: although maybe you wouldn’t think highly of me due to our first encounter,

hangle: 이래 봬도 실력이 나쁜 편은 아니거든.
first_translate: I’m actually quite skilled.
okay, gotcha.

hangle: 근데 그건 같이 가는 거랑 별개의 일이잖아?
first_translate: but that has nothing to do with whether I accompany you or not.
after all, none of this concerns you, right?
fiona,
that wasn’t what I meant...
in other words, what I mean is...

hangle: 여차할 때 방패막이 정도는 해줄 수 있다는 뜻이야.
first_translate: ...that I can act as your shield during emergencies.

hangle: 여기 있는 녀석들은 대부분 너한테 호의적이지 않으니까.
first_translate: most people here aren’t very friendly toward you.
and two heads are better than one...
alright, let’s hurry up already.
h-huh...?
I’m not entirely sure,
but is he worried about me?
well, if not, oh well.
okay.
